title: Mistakes Were Made (But Not by Me)
author: Carol Tavris, Elliot Aronson
review: Wow do we make a lot of irrational decisions. Try to step back to avoid sliding down the pyramid of self-justification. Self-justification allows us to (usually unconsciously) convince ourselves what we did was the right choice/best thing we could have done even if it was definitely not.

title: Being Mortal: Medicine and What Matters in the End
author: Atul Gawande

title: Maybe You Should Talk to Someone
author: Lori Gottlieb

title: The Spy and the Traitor: The Greatest Espionage Story of the Cold War
author: Ben Macintyre

title: Freezing Order
author: Bill Browder
review: Yeah, so I'm not planning on traveling to Russia ever. Browder's previous book, Red Notice, and this book detail the corruption, fraud, injustices, and more that Russia has and continues to commit. Oh and Russia's successfully infected and lured more than a handful of Americans to their side.
